paragraphs.body: I'm really concerned about this. Why is the front page editable? It makes more room for vandals to vandalize the front page or erase the content. I know there are rollback users in the community and you can undo edits with rollback, but it's alarm raising for me. ${link_0} (${link_1} • ${link_2}) 12:33, February 7, 2012 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: I'm really concerned about this. Why is the front page editable? It makes more room for vandals to vandalize the front page or erase the content. I know there are rollback users in the community and you can undo edits with rollback, but it's alarm raising for me. Mystiah (wall • contribs) 12:33, February 7, 2012 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Hi, I saw that someone published a link for an article he made on Avatar's Facebook page. It's dealing with comparing the story of Avatar to the holocaust. It's a literary analysis, because it mostly deals with symbols and metaphors. Maybe it should be reminded if Nickelodeon will response to it.
paragraphs.text: Hi, I saw that someone published a link for an article he made on Avatar's Facebook page. It's dealing with comparing the story of Avatar to the holocaust. It's a literary analysis, because it mostly deals with symbols and metaphors. Maybe it should be reminded if Nickelodeon will response to it.

paragraphs.body: I believe the character boxes on the homepage should be like the following.
paragraphs.text: I believe the character boxes on the homepage should be like the following.

paragraphs.body: First Row: Korra | Mako | Bolin | Asami | Tenzin | Lin (main protagonists).
paragraphs.text: First Row: Korra | Mako | Bolin | Asami | Tenzin | Lin (main protagonists).

paragraphs.body: Second Row: Amon | Lieutenant | Equalists | Hiroshi | Tarrlok | Saikhan (main antagonists).
paragraphs.text: Second Row: Amon | Lieutenant | Equalists | Hiroshi | Tarrlok | Saikhan (main antagonists).

paragraphs.body:
I have noticed that there is still a thing on the main page that says "Anti-bending Revolution: 
The Revolution is upon us. Who will be standing when it is over?". I think that should be removed, or replaced with something more...up to date, because I mean, we already know who won. ${link_0} (${link_1}) 06:18, October 2, 2012 (UTC)
paragraphs.text:
I have noticed that there is still a thing on the main page that says "Anti-bending Revolution: 
The Revolution is upon us. Who will be standing when it is over?". I think that should be removed, or replaced with something more...up to date, because I mean, we already know who won. Weirdo Guy (talk) 06:18, October 2, 2012 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: The title wasn't changed when ${link_0} was announced, in difference from the homepage and articles about ${link_1} and new articles about ${link_2}. It's still "Avatar Wiki | Avatar: The Last Airbender characters, episodes, elements, and more!". The admins need to change it to "Avatar Wiki | Avatar: The Last Airbender and Avatar: The Legend of Korra characters, episodes, elements, and more!", and on other pages from "Avatar Wiki, the Avatar: The Last Airbender resource" to "Avatar Wiki, the Avatar: The Last Airbender and Avatar: The Legend of Korra resource". ${link_3} (${link_4} • ${link_5}) 10:20, November 1, 2012 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: The title wasn't changed when The Legend of Korra was announced, in difference from the homepage and articles about ATLA and new articles about ALOK. It's still "Avatar Wiki | Avatar: The Last Airbender characters, episodes, elements, and more!". The admins need to change it to "Avatar Wiki | Avatar: The Last Airbender and Avatar: The Legend of Korra characters, episodes, elements, and more!", and on other pages from "Avatar Wiki, the Avatar: The Last Airbender resource" to "Avatar Wiki, the Avatar: The Last Airbender and Avatar: The Legend of Korra resource". Galzigler (wall • contribs) 10:20, November 1, 2012 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: So i have been watching through all of The Last Airbender for the 5,678,987th time and i realized something on the episode:${link_0}. When ${link_1} is in the spirit world, and ${link_2} (${link_3} ${link_4}'s Animal Guide) gives him a vision using his whiskers, is it ${link_5}?

links.body: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World

paragraphs.text: So i have been watching through all of The Last Airbender for the 5,678,987th time and i realized something on the episode:Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World. When Aang is in the spirit world, and Fang (Avatar Roku's Animal Guide) gives him a vision using his whiskers, is it Energybending?
